results.title: What's causing the problem?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The second step in performance appraisal is the need to identify and agree on the cause of the work problem before discussing solutions. Examples of no agreement on cause are followed by Peter Quarry demonstrating clear agreement on cause.

results.title: What's an Accountant?
results.creator_credit: Neil McClure, Production Group and CPA Australia
results.brief_description: Tania Lacey introduces a program designed to encourage viewers to consider the possibility of a career in accounting. Discusses common sterotypes of accountants, the prerequisites for an accountancy career and the diverse range of employment opportunities. Wherever you may wish to work - “Accountancy can take you there!”

results.title: What's agro-forestry?
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, CSIRO and Roger Seccombe
results.brief_description: Agro-forestry is a combination of growing pine trees for timber production and pasture for livestock production to gain maximum use of fertilisers and soil nutrients. Various forestry officers and farmers give their opinions on advantages and disadvantages of the scheme.
results.description: Agro-forestry is a combination of growing pine trees for timber production and pasture for livestock production to gain maximum use of fertilisers and soil nutrients. Various forestry officers and farmers give their opinions on advantages and disadvantages of the scheme.

results.title: What's a good book?: selecting books for children
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Joanna Foster
results.brief_description: Various librarians and writers give their opinions as to what constitutes good reading material for children. Shows the decision-making process behind the selection of books for children’s libraries and stresses the need to consider why children like particular books. Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: Wharfie
results.creator_credit: A Fitzroy Flix Film and Barbara Boyd-Anderson
results.brief_description: Impressionistic, non-narrated study of Melbourne Waterfront in which and old ex-wharfie returns to the wharves with his grandson to be confronted by vast technological changes. Still photographs and newspaper headlines refer back to more boisterous days when the wharves employed many more men.

results.title: Whaling
results.creator_credit: Pathé Frères and British Instructional Films
results.brief_description: An account of a modern whaling fleet at work; departure of the whale catcher from the Saldanha bay Whaling Station in South Africa; preparations for the hunt; a whale is sighted; aiming and firing the harpoon gun; harpooning the whale; return to the whaling station; treatment of the whale; rendering of meat and blubber.

results.title: Whales: Can they be saved?
results.creator_credit: Alan P. Sloan, Reid-Cowan Productions and Kenneth Post
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of species within the two major branches of the whale family: the baleen and the toothed whales. Describes their characteristics and behaviour. Because modern whaling is so efficient many whales are in danger of extinction.

results.title: Whales, dolphins and men (D)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Dolphins and whales share a common ancestor; yet dolphins are the darlings of the public, while whales are the victims of commercial exploitation. The dolphin is considered man’s friend and playmate, the whale continues to be a victim of exploitation and face a very real danger of extinction. Discusses scientific studies of these marine mammals. Note: Some scenes may be offensive to animal lovers.

results.title: Whales that wouldn't die
results.creator_credit: Susan K Pollock, KPBS (Television station : San Diego, Calif.) and Frank Christopher
results.brief_description: Studies the characteristics, population density and habitats of the Grey Whale. Discusses the history of whaling, its particular effect on the Grey Whale, and the animal’s future prospects for survival.
